com.thinkaurelius.titan.core

Interface RelationType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element, Idfiable, Namifiable, Removable, TitanElement, TitanSchemaElement, TitanSchemaType, TitanVertex, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EdgeLabel, InternalRelationType, PropertyKey, SystemRelationType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseKey, BaseLabel, BaseRelationType, EdgeLabelVertex, EmptyRelationType, ImplicitKey, PropertyKeyVertex, RelationTypeVertex

    public interface RelationType
extends TitanVertex, TitanSchemaType
    RelationType defines the schema for TitanRelation. RelationType can be configured through RelationTypeMaker to provide data verification, better storage efficiency, and higher retrieval performance.
    Each TitanRelation has a unique type which defines many important characteristics of that relation.
    RelationTypes are constructed through RelationTypeMaker which is accessed in the context of a TitanTransaction via TitanTransaction.makePropertyKey(String) for property keys or TitanTransaction.makeEdgeLabel(String) for edge labels. Identical methods exist on TitanGraph. Note, relation types will only be visible once the transaction in which they were created has been committed.
    RelationType names must be unique in a graph database. Many methods allow the name of the type as an argument instead of the actual type reference. That also means, that edge labels and property keys may not have the same name.
    Author:
    Matthias Bröcheler (me@matthiasb.com);
    See Also:
    TitanRelation, RelationTypeMaker, Titan Type Wiki

      • isPropertyKey

        boolean isPropertyKey()
        Checks if this relation type is a property key
        Returns:
        true, if this relation type is a property key, else false.
        See Also:
